storyInfo: Agni and a group of classmates head to a certain impoverished village in Rim Billiton to help the villagers there during their university holiday, but on the eve of their departure, the students learn that nothing they did ever meant anything.

attributes.content: At long last, we've made it to this day—the day we're capping the roof!
attributes.name: Boastful Student

attributes.content: We left the university and the nomadic city for the first time, and over two entire weeks, brick by brick, with our own hands...
attributes.name: Boastful Student

attributes.content: We built a school in this poor, struggling village!
attributes.name: Boastful Student

attributes.content: Oh, I can already hear the kids reading their books out loud...
attributes.name: Boastful Student

attributes.content: In an empty plot at the edge of the village, a dozen university students are huddled together and chattering in excitement.
Beside them is a newly built two-story building, standing somewhat wobbly.
You done yet? Just hearing you boasting like that makes me want to puke.
attributes.name: Quiet Student

attributes.content: I gotta be honest with you, Agni. You played the biggest role in building this school.
attributes.name: Quiet Student

attributes.content: Haha, not at all.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: I mean it.
attributes.name: Quiet Student

attributes.content: We're a bunch of university students who only know how to talk big. We're always saying how we'll help Rim Billiton's poor, but we had barely any idea what life is even like outside the nomadic cities.
attributes.name: Quiet Student

attributes.content: If it weren't for you reminding us to be more practical and realistic, we'd never have seen for ourselves just how poor this—
attributes.name: Quiet Student

attributes.content: Everyone, let us take a moment and offer our blessings to this building, filled to bursting with our feelings.
attributes.name: Boastful Student

attributes.content: Ugh... What's he up to this time...?
attributes.name: Quiet Student

attributes.content: The boastful student pulls out a bottle of champagne and shakes it violently.
The cork pops out as champagne splashes everywhere. By chance, it lands right between the school building's slanted front door and its door frame.
Hahahahahaha...
attributes.name: Students

attributes.content: Hahaha... Agni... Check out this bloke... crazy...
attributes.name: Quiet Student

attributes.content: What's wrong, Agni? You don't look happy at all.
attributes.name: Quiet Student

attributes.content: Agni points at the villagers standing at a distance.
They act as though neither the newly built school nor the university students are even there. They simply focus on their hard labor. Not one of them has even a hint of a smile on their face.
Who is it?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Oh, hello, headman. I'm Agni, one of the university students here to build the school.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: It's late. Whatever you need, we'll talk tomorrow.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: We're leaving tomorrow. I'm here to say goodbye.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: No need. Feel free to leave on your own time.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Er, no, that's not all. There's something else...
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: We had a pretty crazy time today, so we forgot to give you this.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Here, it's a bottle of champagne to celebrate the new school.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: The village headman makes no effort to take the bottle. Agni places it on the wooden table.
Us country folk don't drink that fancy stuff. Keep it.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: It's an easy enough drink. You can give it a try if you don't believe me.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: The village headman shakes his head, grabs the bottle, and scans the label for a picture he might understand.
What's this? A vineyard? What does that have to do with this 'champagne'?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: It's just a picture the winery slapped on. The same goes for the name. You can think of it as your average bubbly.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Hmph... This stuff isn't any better than the beer we brew.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Then... How about we exchange drinks before we leave tomorrow? We wouldn't mind a taste of the local beer—
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: We don't have any.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Forget the hops. Not even Originium Slugs build their nests around here anymore, not since they found those iron mines.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: How could that be?
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: 'How could that be?'
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: You've been here long enough, you haven't noticed the racket of those mining platforms? When the whole land gets sent shaking on the regular, of course the slugs would go packing.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: We did hear there was a mining platform a couple days ago, but we didn't even notice any—
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Almost as if to lend credence to the villager's words, a thunderous noise suddenly roars from afar.
Noticed it this time?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Take your fancy wine with you, girl.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: What now?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: I've been meaning to ask. Everyone here welcomed us at first, but now that we've finished building the school, they all seem pretty cold. Did we do something wrong?
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: If the quality's not up to your standard, I'll to take responsibility. I'll find you a more reliable construction crew—
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Since you're leaving anyway, I might as well just come out and say it.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: This village never needed a school to begin with.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: We just figured we'd earn some cash with you lot here. Food, lodging, maybe you'd even donate something... It was all about the money.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: But you didn't eat any of our food or stay in any of our houses. You set up tents on empty plots.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Aside from cutting trees and baking bricks for your building, the only business we got from you is roasting beast meat. Pocket change. What good does that do? Who'd be happy with that?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: But if you look at the long term, the new school will give your kids an education. It'll help change your lives for the better—
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: And what's wrong with how we live? Why do we need to change?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Forget it. I don't wanna get into that argument. Lemme ask you a question instead.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Who'll take classes in that building? Where are you gonna find a teacher willing to come teach poor kids in the middle of nowhere, instead of rich kids in the city?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: With a thud, the village headman slams the bottle back on the table.
Sorry... I didn't think it through.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: I thought that as long as we built a school and offered the right pay, someone would apply for the job.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: We don't own any mines, or have any contracts with the mining companies. All their trade routes go around us. Even if we could afford to pay more, who'd want to commute through the wilderness every day?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: We're from different walks of life. Stop wasting your time and go home.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: And take your 'champagne' with you.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: No, could you at least...
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: At least give me some time!
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Stay and become teachers?
attributes.name: Boastful Student

attributes.content: Can't help you with that. Sorry, Agni.
attributes.name: Boastful Student

attributes.content: Why don't we pool some money to hire a teacher?
attributes.name: Quiet Student

attributes.content: I thought about that, but transportation's still a problem. Nobody would come, so it's up to us...
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Did you forget? Classes start in five days.
attributes.name: Quiet Student

attributes.content: Classes...?
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: I gotta get myself a few more credits, or I'll graduate late.
attributes.name: Quiet Student

attributes.content: Classes? Credits? Graduate late?!
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: A-Agni...?
attributes.name: Quiet Student

attributes.content: (Breathes deeply)
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: No offense, but the kids here don't even get an education, yet now we're abandoning them because we have to get back to school? Don't you think that's... ironic?
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: But we're university students. Students attend classes. It's kind of our thing.
attributes.name: Quiet Student

attributes.content: Agni simply stands there. She seems to have a lot on her mind, but isn't able to say any of it out loud.
The other students try to console her, but when she doesn't react, they all simply leave.
They still have bags to pack, credits to earn, and, in due time, diplomas to frame. None of them have time to stand around like Agni.
If you yell loud enough, you could still get 'em to stop the car for you.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: I decided to stay. I'm not going to change my mind.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Sure, teach all you want, but if you ask me, it's not gonna make a difference.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: At the very least, I'll feel like I'm making one.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: You're a stubborn one.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Have been ever since I was a kid. Once I set my mind on something, I never shut up about it. My parents tell me I'm a huge pain in the arse.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: The two of them turn around and slowly walk back to the village.
The villagers are unenthused by the idea of a 'teacher,' but it is also true that they could use someone to watch their kids all day while they work.
And so, Agni obtained permission to teach the children however she pleased. She even put together a class timetable and a curriculum.
But as soon as her classes started, she realized that while she had thought to teach them arithmetic, the kids hadn't even learned to read and write.
After a few days of classes, both her and the children were exhausted.
We can all tell you're really trying to teach them, Agni. You're so much stronger than your classmates.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: But go easy on yourself. Just let the kids run around and play. Don't wear yourself out.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: And what if I don't?
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: What can you even do?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Say you can get the kids to recognize a few words and do some basic maths. How is any of that gonna be useful?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Of course it'll be useful.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: What I'm teaching them is the foundation of knowledge. Only by mastering this can they start learning more advanced subjects and change their lives for the better.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: There you go again with that 'change our lives for the better' stuff.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Agni, we like you here because you're passionate, kind, and don't ask for nothing. Not 'cause you want to change our lives.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Know who else forced us to change our lives, to the point we can't even brew our own beer anymore? The mining companies, that's who.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: But if the children here can widen their horizons and master even more knowledge, they'll definitely get to live better lives.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: How? By going to university?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Well, that's part of it.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Then how much time are you willing to spend tutoring someone till they're a university student like you?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: ...I know I might sound stupid, but I think quitting halfway is much harder than never giving it a shot.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: You really are a stubborn one. If I was your old man, I'd call you a pain in the arse, too.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Suit yourself.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: You still have that bottle of champagne, right?
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: What, you thirsty?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Ha, I'm saving that for a celebration. Why would I drink it now? To drown my sorrows?
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Actually... Today's the day that our university's term starts.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Starting today, if I can give the children an entire term's worth of classes...
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: No matter how much progress they've made, when the term ends, I'll open that bottle with everyone in the village. What do you think?
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: The village headman looks at her and then towards the extravagant champagne bottle stored in the back of the broken cabinet. It looks utterly out of place.
Against the backdrop of the mining platforms' thunderous drilling, the bubbles inside keep floating restlessly upward, in an attempt to break free of the surface of the liquid.
It's your bubbly. That's for you to decide.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: After that, the children learned how to write their names and how to add and subtract. The smarter ones even figured out how to multiply and divide.
Aside from teaching, Agni also gained a certain standing among the villagers thanks to her experience playing with fire, something she'd done since she was a child—
At the very least, when the adults came home to a hungry family and damp firewood producing nothing but smoke, their first instinct had become, 'Quick, go get Agni.'
Before long, an entire month had come and gone.
(Stretches back)
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Finally, that's the end of today's lessons...
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Tired?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: I'm hanging in there.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Think about it. I got through what would be a month and a half's curriculum in normal schools. That's over half a term's worth!
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Which means that in just another month, it'll be time for us to pop open that bottle of champagne—
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Miss Agni! Miss Agni!
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: What's the matter?
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: There's a whole caravan of cars at the entrance to the village. And an old man with fancy clothes who said he wants to see you!
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: What's wrong?
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: ...It's nothing.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: I'm gonna go play, then!
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: Your father?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: ...Probably.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Looks like I won't get to taste this champagne, after all.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: (Taps Agni's shoulder)
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: I'll hold onto it for you. You go see your father.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Dad.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Let's see... Good, good. You're not hurt. Just a little thinner than before.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: I've indulged your eccentricities long enough. It's time you got back to your studies.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: I'm not going back. I promised the villagers I'd teach their kids for a term. We're only halfway through.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: (Sighs)
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: We've gone over half a term's worth of material in a single month. The children here can write their names and add and subtract now! Give us another month and we'll be finished!
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Agni, you know this is pointless.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: Pointless?!
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Will these children live different lives from their parents, just because they know how to write their names and do basic maths?
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: Go back to university.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: Time waits for no one. Every year you delay your graduation, that's another year before I can hand the mines over to you—
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: How many times do I have to tell you? I don't want to take over your mines!
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Everyone else in the caravan stays silent.
The daughter arguing with her father is a familiar sight.
And I've told you this just as many times: I'm blessed to have a kindhearted daughter who thinks of others and realizes how fortunate she is to have been born into a well-off family.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: But you're not willing to understand that in order to truly help these people, you must stand in an even higher position, where you can plan for everyone's benefit by looking at the big picture.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: Let's stop talking about this. We aren't getting anywhere.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: ...You're unwilling to even let me finish.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: How about this? I'll make you a promise.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: You're afraid the children here will be unable to receive an education? I'll hire them a teacher, then. I'll pay top dollar. Someone will come.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: This again? Blackmailing me into accepting your terms by using the people I care about?
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Don't be like this, Agni.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: I simply want to do this for you so you'll seriously consider what I said.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: Think about it. Think about what you could do for this village—and plenty more like it—if you were in my position. No... if you controlled even more resources than I do.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: Agni keeps her head lowered and grits her teeth. She's afraid of looking her father in the eye.
She's afraid of nodding in agreement the moment their eyes meet.
And she feels disgusted with herself for thinking that way.
(Grits teeth)
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: I'll have to talk to the villagers about this.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: So I'll leave, and he'll find a teacher... And that's that.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: So your family...
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: ...actually runs the mines.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: (Nods in silence)
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: The village headman takes the bottle of champagne from the cabinet and shoves it into her chest.
Go home, Agni.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: We never needed a school in the first place, and we definitely don't need one funded by some mine owner.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Don't be like that...
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: I have to.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: I told you before that ever since they found the mines, the Originium Slugs stopped building their nests, but have I told you why we stopped planting hops?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: No...
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Come. Take a walk with me. I'll tell you why.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Look at these barren lands. They used to be full of hops, but now there's nothing.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: When they first built the mining platforms, we thought that once the company arrived, the miners would start flowing in, and they'd need all kinds of things.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: It'd be the perfect chance for us to do business with the mining company.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: But they didn't come to us.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: They built their own supply chain and trading posts and opened them up to everyone. They had just about everything. Grain, fruits, cloth... Right, and beer.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: And they sell them at less than what they cost us to make.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Forget doing business with the company, it didn't take long for the villages we already had relationships with to stop trading with us. What with the company's wares being both better and cheaper.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: That's why we stopped planting hops. No one came for our beer anymore. Everyone started thinking of the company's beer first, even our own people.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Then, the people from the company came. They told us that if we signed our land over to them, they'd compensate us and also hire everyone for great salaries and benefits.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Pfft... Great benefits my arse!
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: I heard from others that if we took their offer and worked for them, they could send us packing any moment. Then, not only would we lose our income, we wouldn't even have land to farm!
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: When Agni sees the village headman so worked up, she remembers what her father just told her.
'Think about it. Think about what you could do for this village—and plenty more like it—if you were in my position. No... if you controlled even more resources than I do.'
Agni... I really believe that you came here to teach the kids how to read and write out of the goodness of your heart.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: But now you're telling me you have to leave, and that your father's company will pay for the school? Why should I trust him, his company?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: And also—
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Maybe this is going a bit too far, but—
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Don't you think you're doing the exact same thing as your father and his competitors?
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: What? How?! In what way am I the same as them?!
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: How are you any different? You want our children to give up their land, go to the nomadic cities, and live the kind of life where they could lose everything at a moment's notice.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Agni's lips are trembling. There are a thousand words she wants to say, but she can't bring herself to voice even a single one of them.
A thunderous rumble can be heard from afar.
Agni had lived in the village long enough to grow accustomed to the roar and its vibrations, but this one is much more intense than usual.
Bugger me, what's with all the shaking this time?!
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Not far from the village, a gigantic mining platform drives right past. The vibration is no less intense than the tremors that precede a Catastrophe.
Agni staggers, finally realizing why the Originium Slugs do not build their nests here anymore.
But she also catches something else out of the corner of her eye.
The school!
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: The school?!
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: The gigantic mining platform slowly drifts away, and the vibrations in its wake gradually subside.
As for the wobbly two-story building built by amateurs, it has crumbled into a pile of debris.
When the vibrations have fully subsided, Agni falls to her knees.
Be thankful that school's out and there was no one inside.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: Go home, Agni. Don't worry about us anymore.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: You're a good girl, but I told you from the start: we're from different walks of life.
attributes.name: Village Headman

attributes.content: The village headman leaves Agni behind and starts walking toward his home.
After a short distance, he turns around to find her still standing there.
'What a stubborn girl,' he thinks to himself, 'but she'll end up like her father in the end. Maybe a decent person, maybe less of a pain in the arse, but much more dangerous.'
But just as he thinks that and is about to turn and go on his way, he sees her grab the bottle of champagne on the ground.
He sees her hold it with both hands and violently shake it up and down, as though what is trapped inside are not champagne bubbles, but somebody's soul.
He sees how she has almost completely exhausted herself just to shake that bottle. And when she's completely spent, she lifts the bottle up high, pointing it toward the sky.
Pop!
He isn't able to hear it very well.
But he can see it clearly. The cork flies straight into the sky. Perhaps it will ultimately land in the rubble, or perhaps not.
The last thing he sees is Agni smashing the bottle onto the ground, before walking away in long strides.
Agni, it's been hours, and you still haven't said a word.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: Pouting isn't going to solve anything.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: Please, you need to look at reality. The bigger the mining business grows, the less hope these villages will have.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: If they'd just abandon their past and embrace their easily reachable future, then both they and their descendants would have the chance to live truly affluent lives.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: And both you and I are working toward a future where that aspiration can come true.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: But you simply don't understand yet. To truly give them better lives, we must first convince them to wake up from their illusions. The quicker this process, the less painful it is.
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: (Laughs dryly)
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: ...Then I have good news for you, Dad. We just took a huge step forward with that.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: The school we built for the village just came crashing down. It couldn't withstand the tremors caused by the mining platform that passed by.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: It collapsed?
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: I didn't even notice. The shaking was quite intense, though. I'll help you rebuild it—
attributes.name: Agni's Father

attributes.content: Are you worried that... I'll go back on our promise?
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Don't worry.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: I've been thinking seriously about what you said. From the moment I got in the car till now.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: There are lots of things I haven't thought through yet—almost everything, actually.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: But there's at least one thing I have.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Honestly, you're a good employer, a good citizen, and... a good father.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: But Rim Billiton has no shortage of good people.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Dad, I'm afraid. I'm afraid that by being a good person for too long, I'll lose sight of the things around me. Like, say... the collapse of a school.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: Which is why I won't be joining the family business.
attributes.name: Agni

attributes.content: ...Dad.
attributes.name: Agni
